description: The Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering at NMSU provides students with the skills to design and develop electrical systems, including circuits, communication networks, and power electronics.
learning_outcomes: Design electrical and electronic circuits using industry-standard tools.
Analyze and simulate systems involving signals and power.
Apply principles of electromagnetism and semiconductor physics.
Communicate technical content effectively in written and oral forms.
Collaborate in teams to solve engineering problems.

exit_points.description: Entry-level credential for supporting hardware and circuit layout work.
Credential for technician-level roles in power systems and network infrastructure.
Credential for roles in embedded electronics and microcontroller programming.

courses.course_name: Intro to Electrical and Computer Engineering

description: The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science provides students with a strong foundation in software engineering, data structures, AI, cybersecurity, and theoretical computer science, preparing them for diverse roles in the tech industry.
learning_outcomes: Design efficient algorithms and data structures.
Develop and maintain complex software systems.
Understand theoretical foundations of computing.
Apply ethical principles in software design.
Work in teams to build real-world applications.

exit_points.description: Credential for web and mobile application support roles.
Ideal for backend development and API support roles.
Preparation for AI/ML assistant-level and testing roles.

description: This Associate of Applied Science in Information Technology prepares students with hands-on skills in networking, cybersecurity, cloud computing, and IT support, tailored for entry-level positions in IT fields.
learning_outcomes: Set up and troubleshoot computer networks.
Use operating systems and command-line tools proficiently.
Understand cybersecurity principles and apply security protocols.
Deploy cloud-based services and manage access control.
Communicate technical concepts effectively in IT teams.

exit_points.description: Credential for entry-level IT support and help desk roles.
Credential for configuring and managing LAN/WAN environments.

description: The Associate of Science in Criminal Justice at NMSU prepares students for entry-level employment in law enforcement, corrections, and legal systems, or for transfer to a four-year degree program.
learning_outcomes: Describe the components and functions of the criminal justice system.
Interpret laws and court decisions relevant to criminal justice.
Apply ethical principles to criminal justice decision-making.
Demonstrate knowledge of correctional philosophies and procedures.
Communicate effectively within criminal justice contexts.

exit_points.description: Credential for supporting roles in detention or rehabilitation facilities.
Credential for assistant-level duties in police departments or agencies.

description: The Associate of Science in Business Administration provides a foundational understanding of accounting, economics, communication, and management, and prepares students to either transfer to a bachelor's degree or enter the workforce.
learning_outcomes: Demonstrate understanding of accounting and financial principles.
Apply basic economic theories to real-world scenarios.
Communicate effectively in business contexts.
Understand legal and ethical aspects of business.
Work collaboratively and think critically in business decisions.

exit_points.description: Credential for general office, billing, or bookkeeping support roles.
Credential for entry-level operations and administrative support.

description: The Accounting A.A. program at Santa Fe Community College prepares students for transfer to four-year universities or entry-level accounting careers. It includes financial and managerial accounting, tax prep, and QuickBooks training.
learning_outcomes: Prepare and analyze financial statements and reports.
Utilize QuickBooks for business transaction tracking.
Apply accounting principles to business scenarios.
Interpret economic data for decision-making.
Communicate accounting information effectively.

exit_points.description: Prepares students for roles as bookkeeping clerks using financial software like QuickBooks.
Qualifies students for basic tax prep and financial assistant roles.

description: The Business Administration A.A. at SFCC prepares students for transfer to a bachelor’s degree or entry-level business roles. It includes accounting, economics, marketing, and business law fundamentals.
learning_outcomes: Understand core business functions and operations.
Analyze financial and accounting data to support decision-making.
Explain micro and macroeconomic principles and their applications.
Demonstrate ethical reasoning and legal understanding in business.
Communicate effectively in a professional business environment.

exit_points.description: Support roles in administration and entry-level business operations.
Intermediate credential supporting small business or project coordination.

description: The Computer Science A.S. at SFCC prepares students for transfer to a four-year CS degree or entry into IT-related fields. The program includes programming, data structures, discrete math, computer architecture, and more.
learning_outcomes: Design and implement software using modern programming languages.
Apply data structures and algorithms to solve computing problems.
Demonstrate understanding of computer hardware and architecture.
Analyze and debug programs effectively.
Work collaboratively and communicate technical concepts clearly.

exit_points.description: Entry-level IT and help desk support roles.
Basic programming and software testing roles in tech companies.

description: The Associate Degree in Nursing (ADN) program prepares graduates to take the NCLEX-RN and enter the workforce as a registered nurse. The curriculum includes classroom, lab, and clinical training in key areas of patient care.
learning_outcomes: Demonstrate safe and effective nursing care practices.
Apply clinical reasoning and evidence-based practice.
Collaborate with healthcare teams to improve patient outcomes.
Communicate effectively with patients and healthcare staff.
Promote health and wellness across the lifespan.

exit_points.description: Entry-level credential after basic nursing courses for patient care technician roles.
Mid-level nursing exit for LPN licensure.

description: The Psychology A.A. degree at Santa Fe Community College introduces students to foundational psychological theories and research, preparing them for transfer to four-year institutions or entry-level roles in human services.
learning_outcomes: Understand core psychological concepts, including cognitive, behavioral, and developmental theories.
Analyze human behavior using scientific methods.
Demonstrate critical thinking and ethical awareness in psychological practice.
Apply psychological theories to real-world issues and personal growth.
Communicate psychological ideas clearly in both written and oral formats.

exit_points.description: Support role in social services, rehab centers, and mental health programs.
Mid-level credential supporting therapists or counselors.
